record.field: 1. A can do a piece of work in 6 days and B can do it in 4 days. How long will they take if both work together?
2. 30% of a number is 120. Which is the number?
3. The sum of two numbers is 44 and they are in the ratio 5:6. Find the numbers:
4. Find out the best explanation for the following statement from the answer choices:

p.b: Grapes are cheaper than apples. I do not have money to buy two kilograms of grapes.

record.field: A. I cannot buy two kilograms of grapes
B. I can buy on kilograms of grapes
C. I cannot buy one kilograms of grapes and one kilograms of apples
D. I can buy two kilograms of apples
5. A person was going towards south, then turn left again, then right. After that he turned about. In which direction is he now?
6. If the 11th day of a month having 31 days is a Saturday, which of the following days will occur five times in that month?
7. The independent auditor’s primary responsibility is to _____
8. Assuming that it is not the first appointment of the auditor, who is responsible for the appointment of the auditor?
A. The shareholders in a general meeting
C. The board of directors in a board meeting
9. Which one of the following is NOT a duty of the auditor?
A. Duty to report to the company’s bankers
B. Duty to report to the members
C. Duty to sign the audit report
D. Duty to report on any violation of law
10. When an auditor is proposed for removal from office, which one of the following is he NOT permitted to do?
B. Apply to the court to have the proposal removed
C. Speak at the AGM/EGM where the removal is proposed
D. Receive notification of the AGM/EGM where the removal is proposed
11. A sale of Rs. 50.000 to A was entered as a sale to B. This is an example of _____
12. Why do auditors concentrate their efforts on material items in accounts?
A. Because they are easier to audit
B.Because it reduces the audit time
C. Because the risk to the accounts of their being incorrectly stated is greater
D. Because the directors have asked for it
13. Which of the following is not true about opinion on financial statements?
A. The auditor should express an opinion on financial statements
B. His opinion is no guarantee to future viability of business
C. He is responsible for detection and prevention of frauds and errors in financial statements
D. He should examine whether recognised accounting principle have been consistently
14. When the auditor is an employee of the organization being audited (auditee), the audit is classified as an _____ quality audit
15. Each of the three parties involved in an audit _____ plays a role that contributes to its success
A. the client, the auditor, and the auditeer
B. the client, the auditor, and the audite
C. the client, the moderator, and the auditee
D. the client, the auditor, and the auditee
16. An audit is usually conducted in three steps:

ol.li: A pre-examination or opening meeting with the auditee marks the beginning of the process
Involves a suitability audit of the documented procedures against the selected reference standard
The auditor examines in depth the implementation of the quality system

record.field: 17. The audit final report should include, at a minimum, the following:The audit final report should include, at a minimum, the following:

ol.li: Identification of involved parties: auditor, auditee, and third party
Audit standards and reference documents used

record.field: 18. The time requires and costs involved in an external audit are much higher as compared to internal audits
19. Audit is a fact finding process that compares actual results with _____
20. Confirmation of the court is necessary for _____
C. conversion of shares into stock
22. Verification of the value of assets, liabilities, the balance of reserves, provision and the amount of profit earned or loss suffered a firm is called:
23. Vouching of the balances of all incomes and expenses account is known as vouching of _____
24. The main object of the audit of the cash book may be _____
A. to verify the assets and liabilities
B. to know that all receipts and payments have been properly recorded
C. to check the internal control system in business
D. to check the bank balance
25. One of the audit procedures to check the issue of share capital of the newly formed company is _____
A. the memorandum of association and articles of association
26. The quantity of audit working papers compiled on engagement would most be affected by _____
B. auditor experience and professional judgment
27. Which of the following statements is not correct regarding removal of the first auditor before expiry of the term?
A. He is removed at a general meeting
B. The shareholders are authorized to do soT
C. The approval of the central government is required for such removal
D. The provision for such removal are contained in section 224(7)
28. The statutory auditor of a Government Company submits his report to _____
A. the BOD of the company
29. Which of the following statements is, generally, correct about the reliability of audit evidence?
A. To be reliable, evidence should conclusive rather than persuasive
B. Effective internal control system provides reliable audit evidence
C. Evidence obtained from outside sources routes through the client
30. When is evidential matter, generally, considered sufficient?
A. When it constitutes entire population
B. When it is enough to provide a basis for giving reasonable assurance regarding truthfulness
C. When it is objective and relevant
D. When auditor collects and evaluates it independently
